passages.title: The Lost Dog
passages.text: Tom was walking home from school when he noticed a small dog following him. The dog looked tired and hungry. Tom decided to take the dog home and give it some food. Later, he put up posters in the neighbourhood to find the owner.

questions.stem: Why did Tom take the dog home?
choices: Because it looked tired and hungry.
Because he knew it was his neighbour's dog.
Because he wanted a new pet.
questions.explanation: The passage says the dog looked tired and hungry.

questions.stem: What did Tom do to find the dog's owner?
questions.explanation: He put up posters in the neighbourhood.

passages.title: The School Trip
passages.text: Year 5 went on a trip to the science museum. The children were excited to see the space exhibition. Sarah enjoyed the model of the solar system the most. At the end of the trip, everyone wrote down their favourite part.

questions.stem: Where did Year 5 go on their trip?
questions.explanation: The trip was to the science museum.

questions.stem: What did Sarah enjoy the most?
questions.explanation: She enjoyed the model of the solar system.

passages.title: A Rainy Day
passages.text: It rained all morning, and the playground was too wet for football. Instead, the children stayed inside and played board games. Some read books quietly in the reading corner. By the afternoon, the rain had stopped, and the sun came out.

questions.stem: Why couldn’t the children play football?
questions.explanation: The playground was too wet from the rain.

questions.stem: What did some children do indoors?
questions.explanation: Some children read books in the reading corner.

passages.title: The Bee
passages.text: Bees are very important insects. They help plants grow by carrying pollen from one flower to another. This is called pollination. Without bees, many fruits and vegetables would not grow properly.

questions.stem: What job do bees do for plants?

choices: Plants would still grow the same.
Fruits and vegetables might not grow properly.
questions.explanation: Without bees, many fruits and vegetables would not grow properly.

passages.title: The Gift
passages.text: It was Anna’s birthday. Her best friend gave her a box wrapped in shiny paper. Inside was a book Anna had wanted for a long time. Anna was delighted and thanked her friend warmly.

questions.stem: What was inside the gift box?
How did Anna feel about the gift?
questions.explanation: Anna was delighted and thanked her friend.
